ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: how to make a good presentation. how to communicate as a native speaker.
Ability of using English for presentation. Pronunciation, ways of English Learning
I have learned how to make academic presentation in American classes. I have practiced and expanded fluency skills in academic conversations. I have also developed and refined academic vocabulary.
I think this class helps me improve my English.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strength: High engagement of English learning, multiply practice on the same presentation, reading with rhythm Weakness: the total length of the course is a little bit long

In relation to the activities we did in this course, how to organize presentations was the most helpful to me. I have used those rules and skills in my presentations in Graduate School. On the other hand, I think we might spend less time on class to practice rhythm of the sentence. It could be difficult to change the long-term developed habit of speaking English sentences in such a short time. It might be more effective to teach the rules in class and ask us practice by ourselves. By this way, we may have more time in class to learn other things.
Strengths: everyone has a chance to practice English. Weaknesses: too many students in one class result in low efficiency.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I recommend this course to other students, especially those who would like to improve their fluency skills in academic English.
It is a good class to practice English.
